summary: Alan G. Sentinella testified before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) on May 21, 1975, regarding investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. His testimony covered his involvement in these investigations, focusing on telephone surveillance, alleged communist connections, and the FBI's operational policies. The documents consist of his testimony and recollections of that testimony.
significance: While the documents provided focus on Sentinella's involvement in investigations related to Martin Luther King Jr., the SCLC, and Stanley Levison, his testimony before the Senate Select Committee suggests a broader role within the FBI and potentially insights into surveillance and operational policies that could be relevant to understanding the context of the JFK assassination, though no direct connection is made in these documents.
